Title: Vishen's Newsletter: How to reclaim your brain and focus

Sub
How to Improve Your Brain and Gain Focus

The Day My Brain Humbled Me
Let me take you back a couple of years. It was shortly after I recovered from COVID. I had just walked into Dr. Daniel Amen’s brain clinic in Southern California, feeling like a rockstar.
Why? Because I had proof I was in amazing health.
At 46, my biological age test came back as… drumroll, please… 20 years old! My Glycanage results were so good I half-expected Dr. Amen to scan my brain and say something like:
"Vishen, we’ve never seen a brain this exceptional. You’re like the Einstein of 2020s biohackers."
But what I got instead was a harsh dose of reality.
“Vishen,” Dr. Amen said, “your brain is aging faster than your body. You’ve got the brain of someone in their fifties.”
Hold on. What?
My jaw practically hit the floor. How could this be possible? My body was thriving! I was practicing HIIT, meditating, and following a solid diet.
But my brain? It was underperforming.
Dr. Amen explained a few potential causes. COVID was still wreaking havoc on my system, for one. But then he mentioned something else that stuck with me: “You might want to stop drinking alcohol.”
Now, let me confess something. I wasn’t exactly a heavy drinker—just four glasses of wine a week. But I couldn’t shake his words. Could even a little bit of alcohol be holding my brain back?
That’s when I decided to take matters into my own hands.
The 4-Week Experiment That Changed My Life
When I got back to Europe, I decided to make some changes. I didn’t wait for Monday. I didn’t tell myself, “I’ll start next month.”
I went all in.
For the next four weeks, I cut out alcohol completely. No wine, no champagne, not even a celebratory toast at a dinner party.
I also revamped my diet. Inspired by the WildFit protocol, I stuck to a strict regimen of meat, veggies, and whole foods. No sugar. No processed snacks. Just pure, nourishing fuel for my body and brain.
I’ll be honest—it wasn’t easy. Those first few days were rough. I missed my evening glass of wine. I craved sweets after meals. But something magical happened around the one-week mark.
My focus started improving.
And I don’t mean a little. I mean dramatically.
- Tasks that used to take hours suddenly flew by.
- I felt sharp, alert, and present in every conversation.
- Creative ideas poured out of me like water from a tap.
By the end of the four weeks, I felt like a different person. My productivity was off the charts, my mind felt alive, and I realized something important: I’d only scratched the surface.
Six Months Later: A Brain Reborn
That four-week experiment turned into a six-month alcohol-free journey. No exceptions. And let me tell you—the transformation was nothing short of miraculous.
Not only was my focus at an all-time high, but I also noticed a ripple effect across every area of my life.
- I was more present with my family.
- My creativity surged to levels I hadn’t experienced in years.
- Tasks that once felt overwhelming became almost effortless.
At work, I reached new heights of productivity. What used to take me five days now took two and a half. That freed up time to launch new projects, like the Mindvalley States supplement line and the Future Human Festival in Dubai.
And it wasn’t just about cutting out alcohol. Along the way, I discovered a few other brain hacks that supercharged my focus and clarity—and I want to share them with you today.
3 Tools to Reclaim Your Focus and Brain Health
1. Reduce Your Baseline Stress
2. Stress is one of the sneakiest brain killers. It chips away at your focus, creativity, and mental resilience.
The good news? You can rewire your brain to naturally reduce stress. One of the most powerful tools I’ve found is Paul McKenna’s Everyday Bliss Hypnotherapy.
It’s a short audio session available on Mindvalley that rewires your brain to release stress and create a sense of calm. Paul recommends listening to it for seven consecutive days—and trust me, the results are mind-blowing.
I use it regularly to stay grounded, focused, and clear-headed, even during the most hectic weeks.
1. Upgrade Your Brain Chemistry
2. Let’s talk about supplements. I’m not a fan of pharmaceutical solutions that promise focus but come with side effects. Instead, I turned to natural compounds that enhance brain function.
Two standouts:
- Alpha GPC: Boosts cognition and memory.
- Paraxanthine (ParaZanthin): A cleaner caffeine alternative that delivers focus without the jitters.
I loved these so much I worked with my team to create the Mindvalley Focus Pill, combining these compounds with other brain-boosting ingredients. It’s like a shortcut to flow state—natural, effective, and sustainable.
1. Master Your Attention with Nir Eyal
2. Distractions are everywhere. Social media. Endless notifications. That email you “just have to check.”
Nir Eyal’s Becoming Focused and Indistractable Quest on Mindvalley helped me reclaim my attention and eliminate distractions. Nir is a former tech insider who once taught app developers how to make their platforms addictive. Now, he’s teaching people how to break free.
His methods are simple, practical, and incredibly effective for staying on track and doing your best work.
Why Your Brain Deserves More Love
We live in a world obsessed with aesthetics. People spend hours perfecting their abs, sculpting their biceps, and toning their glutes. But let me ask you this:
When was the last time you did something to strengthen your brain?
The truth is, your brain is your most valuable asset. It’s what drives your creativity, your productivity, and your ability to connect deeply with others. But because it’s invisible, we often take it for granted.
That was my mistake. I thought I could coast by without giving my brain the attention it deserved. But once I started prioritizing it, everything in my life improved.
Your Next Steps
If you’re ready to unlock your brain’s full potential, here’s where to start:
1. Try Paul McKenna’s Everyday Bliss Hypnotherapy for seven days straight.
2. Experiment with the Mindvalley Focus Pill to fuel your brain naturally.
3. Join Nir Eyal’s Becoming Focused and Indistractable Quest to master your attention and eliminate distractions.
Your brain is the gateway to your dreams. Treat it well, and it will reward you with focus, creativity, and limitless potential.
To your transformation,
Vishen

Subject Lines That Spark Curiosity:

- “Holiday Burnout Is Real—Here’s Your Science-Backed Survival Guide.”
- “The Unexpected Truth About Stress That Boosted Exam Scores by 9%.”
Optional Subject Lines That Inspire Action:
- “From Burnout to Breakthrough: A Holiday Guide to Thriving.”
- “Feeling Stressed? Here’s How to Turn It Into Fuel.”

Newsletter
Hi [First Name],
Let’s be honest—this time of year can feel like trying to sprint a marathon that started back in January. Thanksgiving leftovers are barely gone, and suddenly we’re juggling year-end deadlines, holiday parties, and the gift-buying pressure. It’s no wonder December often feels like a swirling vortex of burnout.
But what if I told you there’s a way to flip the script on stress?
Today, I want to share an insight that could completely rewire how you handle stress—not just during the holiday madness, but in life overall. It’s backed by science and so simple that it might just blow your mind.
And the best part? It’s already working for people like you.
The Experiment That Proved Stress Can Be Your Ally
Picture this: two groups of students, both facing high-stakes situations.
Group 1 is about to play a major sports game. They’re nervous—but in a good way. Their hearts are racing, adrenaline is surging, but they feel ready to crush it.
Group 2 is preparing for a huge exam. Same adrenaline, same rapid heartbeats—but instead of confidence, they feel dread, panic, even a mental shutdown.
Same body response, two wildly different outcomes.
This got psychologist Jeremy Jamieson wondering: What if it’s not the stress itself, but how we interpret it that makes the difference?
So, Jamieson ran an experiment. He handed a simple note to half the students taking the GRE (the academic version of climbing Mount Everest):
“People think that feeling anxious while taking a standardized test will make them do poorly on the test. However, recent research suggests that arousal doesn’t hurt performance on these tests and can even help performance—people who feel anxious during a test might actually do better. This means that you shouldn’t feel concerned if you do feel anxious while taking today’s GRE test. If you find yourself feeling anxious, simply remind yourself that your arousal could be helping you do well.”
The results were jaw-dropping.
The students who didn’t get the note scored 706. But those who read the tiny note? They scored 770. That’s a 9% boost—just by reframing how they thought about stress.
Why This Matters for You
This study reveals something extraordinary: stress isn’t the villain it’s made out to be. It’s how we perceive stress that determines whether it drags us down or lifts us up.
Stress boils down to two factors:
1. Biochemistry—the physical sensations (racing heart, sweaty palms, adrenaline).
2. Belief—the story you tell yourself about what those sensations mean.
When you see stress as harmful, it drains you. But when you view it as a sign of your body gearing up for greatness, it becomes your secret weapon.
Rewiring Your Relationship with Stress
Let’s dive into the tools that can help you turn stress into your ally:
1. Reframe Stress in Real Time
Here are two powerful Mindvalley programs to get you started. Both are part of your Mindvalley membership. 
The 5 Elements of Happiness by Dr. Tal Ben-Shahar
Tal is one of the most sought-after professors on positive psychology and used to be one of Harvard’s leading professors. In this Quest, he dives deep into how we can cultivate happiness—even in the face of challenges. If burnout is your main concern, skip to Chapter 5. This section focuses on recovery techniques that will help you bounce back from stress, reset your energy, and find joy again.
Calm Mind by Dr. Caroline Leaf
If your stress feels like it’s spiraling into anxiety or affecting your mental health, Dr. Leaf’s program is essential. She specializes in neuroplasticity—how you can literally rewire your brain to handle stress differently.

2. Tap Into Your Subconscious
Stress patterns often hide in your subconscious. That’s why tools like hypnotherapy can make a huge difference:
Hypnotic Trance for Bliss by Paul McKenna
I’ve mentioned this audio before, but it’s worth repeating. Paul’s hypnotherapy session uses cutting-edge sound technology to rewire your subconscious mind. It’s like a master reset for your stress response.
I’ve personally seen how just seven days of listening can dramatically shift how you experience stress. You’ll start feeling calmer, more balanced, and better equipped to handle whatever life throws your way.
Listen to this on the Mindvalley app and make sure you listen with headphones as it uses unique sound patterns to rewire your brain in 23 mins. 
3. Support Your Body
Stress isn’t just mental—it’s physical. To truly thrive, you need to support your body too. Here’s a list of the most important supplements to help you. I crafted this list with the help of Shawn Wells, one of the leading supplement scientists in the world today and the author of The Ultimate Guide to Supplements on Mindvalley. 

Here’s Shawn’s advice on the Top Ten Supplements for Releasing Stress, Avoiding Burnout and deepening relaxation. The rating is based on their effectiveness on a score of 1 to 10 compared to other similarly studied supplements. 

Adaptogens
1. Ashwagandha (9/10)
2. Advantage: Lowers cortisol, enhances energy, and boosts resilience to stress. Highly effective for overall stress management.
3. Rhodiola Rosea (8/10)
4. Advantage: Reduces mental fatigue and enhances physical and emotional resilience. Ideal for those dealing with exhaustion.
5. Holy Basil (8/10)
6. Advantage: Balances mood, reduces anxiety, and supports emotional well-being while strengthening immunity.
Nervous System Support
1. Magnesium (10/10)
2. Advantage: A go-to for calming the nervous system, reducing muscle tension, and improving sleep. Glycinate is best for relaxation; L-Threonate for brain health.
3. L-Theanine (9/10)
4. Advantage: Provides calm focus by increasing alpha brain waves. Perfect for daytime stress relief without causing drowsiness.
5. GABA (8/10)
6. Advantage: Reduces acute anxiety and promotes calmness. Ideal for quick relaxation during overwhelming moments.
Mood Regulation
1. Vitamin B Complex (8/10)
2. Advantage: Boosts energy, supports neurotransmitter function, and combats stress-related fatigue and burnout.
3. Omega-3 Fatty Acids (9/10)
4. Advantage: Reduces inflammation and supports emotional stability. Excellent for chronic stress and mood management.
5. 5-HTP (8/10)
6. Advantage: Helps produce serotonin, regulating mood and improving sleep. Great for emotional stability and stress-related insomnia.
Other Beneficial Supplements
1. CBD Oil (9/10)
2. Advantage: Reduces anxiety quickly and promotes relaxation without psychoactive effects. Effective for both acute and chronic stress.
You can buy any of the above on your local online or real world pharmacy. Just know that CBD is yet to be legal in some countries. 

Finally Shawn and I developed our own brand of supplement to help with stress. It’s called ZEN and is an intelligent stack of multiple ingredients that combine to create a deep restful state. 

PIC OF ZEN

That’s where Zen by Mindvalley comes in, crafted with top-notch ingredients like:
- L-Theanine for calm focus.
- Apigenin to promote deep, restful sleep.
- Rhodiola Rosea to balance stress hormones.
- Magnolia Bark to soothe anxiety.
I take Zen almost daily, especially after lunch. It’s become my secret weapon for navigating busy days without feeling frazzled.

Get it from MindvalleyStates.com.
Turn Stress Into Your Superpower
This holiday season, I challenge you: when stress comes knocking, don’t resist it. Embrace it. Channel it. Let it propel you toward your goals.
You’ve got this—and I’m here cheering you on.
With love and gratitude,
Vishen

Name: Vishen's Newsletter: Goals for the New Year ["1,2: Daily", "1,2: Highlights ", "1,2: Weekly", 3: Members, 5: Coach, "1,2,3: Vishen's List", 5: Events, 6: Mastery]
Title: Vishen's Newsletter: Goals for the New Year

📧 Email:
Subject Line:
“Matthew McConaughey’s advice for creating your best 2025"
Preheader: "Forget Resolutions—This is the Real Key to Your Best Year"
The Newsletter

Hey Name,
This is more than just a newsletter. I'm going to share the exact approach that transforms lives—including Matt's, and my own—and give you a personal AI tool I created to guide you in crafting and refining your 2025 goals. (Stick with me, keep reading, and I promise this will be worth it.)

We’re about to enter 2025. And if there’s one thing I’ve learned after years of experimenting with goal-setting, it’s this: the year ahead doesn’t happen to you—it happens through you.
That’s why it’s so important to go into this year intentionally. I don’t mean scribbling down New Year’s resolutions that vanish by February. I’ve never been a fan of those.
I’m talking about stepping into 2025 with clear desires, intentions, and a vision for who you want to become.
This isn’t just about what you’ll do, achieve, or acquire. It’s about setting an energetic tone for the entire year—clarifying the habits, beliefs, and sense of self you’re committed to.
Let me share something wild to inspire you. It’s a story from a conversation I had with Matthew McConaughey when he came on the Mindvalley Podcast.
The Dorm Room Dream That Changed Everything


Picture this: It’s 1992. Matthew McConaughey isn’t the Oscar-winning star we know today. He’s a college kid, sleeping on the top bunk of a dorm bed, probably trying to figure out life like the rest of us at that age.

But one night, he does something that changes his life forever.
He grabs a piece of paper and writes down 10 goals he wants to accomplish.
That’s it. No special system, no apps, no SMART goals. Just a list of things he deeply wanted in his soul. Most of the goals are simple.

Become a father.
Take more risks. 
Just keep livin.
But one goal stands out.

“Win an Academy Award for Best Actor.”
Now, if you look at that list (yes, he shared it in his book Greenlights), it’s… unconventional. 
It doesn’t follow the rules of goal-setting you might’ve heard before.
- It’s not “realistic.” After all, only one person gets an Academy Award for best actor every year.
- It’s not measurable. 
- It’s not time-bound. No deadline.

By every traditional standard, that list would’ve been written off as wishful thinking.
But 20 years later, Matthew was on stage at the Academy Awards, holding that golden statue.
What the heck happened?
How did something so bold, so “unrealistic,” become reality?
And here’s the kicker: Not only did Matthew win that Oscar, but every single goal on that list eventually came true.

PS - you can watch the 5 minute snippet from my interview with Matthew McConaughey where he talks about these ideas here on my @vishen instagram:

https://www.instagram.com/p/DALO37Lou84/
Manifesting Is Real—Here’s Why It Works
What Matthew did here wasn’t just a fluke or luck.
When he shared his story, I realized he had tapped into something deeper—something I believe in with every fiber of my being: Manifestation is real.
Your reality is created by the dominant thoughts in your mind.
It’s not a coincidence that Cambridge Dictionary chose “manifest” as the word of the year for 2024. More and more people are realizing that when you focus powerfully on a vision—especially one that’s tied to an emotional, heartfelt desire—you shift the odds of it becoming real.
Matthew summed it up perfectly with a phrase I’ll never forget:


“The target attracts the arrow.”

Take a moment to reflect on that.
Your vision—the “target”—isn’t passive. It pulls the arrow of your life toward it. It guides you. It whispers in your ear, nudges you toward the right people, the right ideas, the right opportunities.
The target attracts the arrow.
What Larry Page and Google Taught Me About Bold Goals

But there’s another layer to what Matthew did—and it has to do with the nature of the goals he set.
Let me take you back to my time at the University of Michigan. Larry Page, the co-founder of Google, and I both attended a leadership program called LeaderShape while we were there. And this program stressed one thing to all the undergrads who attended - leadership is about big goals and unrealistic visions. 
Years later, Larry spoke about something called the 50-50 Rule.
It’s simple:

50% of your goals should have a 50% chance of failure.

Why? Because when you stretch yourself to aim for audacious, “impossible” goals, even if you don’t hit them, you end up achieving more than you would have with smaller, safer goals.
This wasn’t just a theory for Larry—it became a core practice at Google.
How the 50-50 Rule Transformed Google
Take Google’s early days with YouTube as an example.
When Google acquired YouTube, it wasn’t yet the global video giant we know today. Larry Page set an audacious goal:
“Let’s hit 1 billion views in a single day.”
At the time, this seemed absurd. YouTube was still a niche platform, and 1 billion daily views was a staggering number.
They didn’t hit the goal right away. But aiming for it forced their teams to think bigger. They had to innovate at a pace that no one else in the industry could match.
And guess what? Today, YouTube gets over 5 billion HOURS of video per day.
Another example? Google’s moonshot projects, like self-driving cars or internet balloons to bring connectivity to rural areas.
These aren’t “safe” goals. They’re bold, they’re risky, and they come with a high chance of failure.
But here’s the magic: When failure is acceptable, thinking small isn’t.
This philosophy didn’t just push Google to achieve extraordinary things—it also created a culture where employees were free to dream big without fear.
If you’re hitting every single goal you set, you’re not thinking big enough.
This same principle can be applied to your PERSONAL goals. 

Now, look at Matthew’s list.
He had a mix of “easier” goals and incredibly bold ones. Winning an Academy Award? That’s a 50-50 goal if I’ve ever seen one.
Here’s the thing: Even if Matthew hadn’t won that Oscar, his life wouldn’t have been a failure. Because the process of striving for that level of excellence elevated every other area of his life.
What Are Your 50-50 Goals for 2025?
This brings me to you.
As you think about your goals for 2025, I want you to challenge yourself.
- Add a couple of goals that feel slightly impossible.
- Be okay with failure. It’s not the opposite of success—it’s often the path to it.
And here’s the final piece:
Alongside your bold, 50-50 goals, include what I call “self-fulfilling goals.” I describe this idea in my book “The Code of the Extraordinary Mind.”
These are simple, meaningful goals that you can achieve no matter what.
For example:
- I will truly love myself.
- I will learn and grow every day.
- I will experience the beauty of the world daily.
Think about it: Even if you lost everything tomorrow, you could still accomplish these goals. Imagine someone homeless in New York. Even in those dire circumstances this person could walk through a park and admire the trees. They could pick up a book from the New York public library for free and learn something new. If truly in touch with themselves they could experience self-love through compassion practices. 

These goals are designed to be easy. 
These goals remind you that you’re winning, even when life feels hard. And this is a good feeling to have to fuel you to pursue bigger goals. For Matthew these were things like “Chase my best self” and “Look back and enjoy the view”.
Your 2025 Blueprint

Here’s how to start:
1. Write Down 10 Goals.
    - Make 2-3 of them bold (50% chance of failure).
    - Add a few self-fulfilling goals that keep you grounded.
    - Include the usual goals that feel achievable but still meaningful.
1. Write This Phrase at the Bottom of Your List:
    - “The target attracts the arrow.”
1. Place Your List Somewhere You’ll See It Daily.
Let 2025 be the year you dream big, fail boldly, and win anyway.

Now a surprise. To help you really craft your 2025 Goals I’ve created a simple AI tool for you to use powered by OpenAI. Simple type in your goals in this AI and it will analyze your 2025 goals and help you improve and refine them. 

Here’s the link:
https://chatgpt.com/g/g-675f2f2cd4e88191af9c72bdeb1092a1-goal-analysis-gpt-by-mindvalley

If you want a glimpse of how this work paste this set of random goals as input and you can see the AI magic at work:

1. Find my soulmate
2. Read a book a week
3. Get to 13% bodyfat
4. Bond better with my brother
5. Go on two family vacations
6. Save 10% of my income and place it in index funds
7. Write the first 50 pages of my new book
8. 7 Day road trip across Indonesia.

The Final Word
Matthew McConaughey’s story isn’t just inspiring—it’s proof that when you align your vision with your actions, the universe moves with you.
So, grab a piece of paper. Give yourself the space to dream.
And remember, the target attracts the arrow.
Here’s to an extraordinary 2025.
With love and belief in your greatness,
Vishen
Next Steps for Mindvalley Members:

Title: Vishen's Newsletter: The Most Important Thing You Can Do in 2025
📧 Audience: "1,2: Daily","1,2: Highlights ","1,2: Weekly",3: Members,5: Coach,"1,2,3: Vishen's List",5: Events,6: Mastery
📧 Email:
Subject Lines
1. "The One Habit That Will Radically Transform Your 2025"
2. "Want to Be 37 Times Better by 2026? Start Here."
3. "The Most Important Thing You Can Do in 2025"
Optional Subject Lines
1. "Forget Resolutions—Try This Instead"
2. "Why 2025 Will Be Your Year of Exponential Growth"
3. "Unlock a Life-Changing Habit in 19 Seconds Flat"
The Most Important Resolution for 2025
Image option 1:

Image option 2:

Hey there,
As we stand at the brink of 2025, let me ask you a question:
What’s the one thing you could commit to every single week in 2025 that would create the biggest impact on your life?
Think about it. What single act, if done consistently, could make the difference between merely surviving another year and absolutely thriving?
This question came up in a podcast interview I recently did, and I knew I had to share my answer with you because it could genuinely transform your life.
Here’s the thing: This isn’t a resolution. It’s not about hitting the gym five times a week or meditating for 30 minutes every morning. Those are great habits, but this is something bigger.
It’s not a goal either. Goals are outcomes. This is a practice—one that takes less than 19 seconds to start (yes, I timed it) but could make 2025 your most transformational year yet.
What is it?
Non-Negotiable Learning Time
It sounds simple, almost too simple. But stick with me because this idea is deceptively powerful.
Here’s how it works:
In any job or career—or even life in general—there’s a danger of stagnation if all you ever do is “the work.” You get caught up in your daily tasks, putting out fires, and meeting deadlines. But when you carve out even a small amount of sacred, untouchable time to grow yourself, the results are exponential.
And I mean that literally.
Let me explain.
If you commit to improving by just 1% every single day, do you know how much better you’d be at the end of a year? Most people guess they’d double their abilities. But that’s not even close.
Here’s the math (and yes, I love math for stuff like this):
If you improve by 1% daily, by the end of the year, you’ll be 37.78 times better. That’s a 3,778% improvement!
This is the power of compounding—not in your finances, but in your skills, knowledge, and capabilities.
What Is Non-Negotiable Learning Time?
This idea comes from management theory. It’s the principle that if all you do is work, you’ll eventually stagnate. But if you carve out sacred, untouchable time to grow, you’ll unlock exponential growth—not just in your career but in every area of your life.
Here’s how it works:
If you work 40 hours a week, take two of those hours and dedicate them solely to learning. And I mean true learning—not multitasking with a podcast while driving, but intentional, focused learning.
If you’re a business owner, those two hours could be spent diving into books on leadership, studying the latest AI innovations, or taking a class on scaling a company.
If you’re a parent, maybe you spend that time learning about emotional intelligence, mindful parenting, or financial literacy to set your family up for success.
The key is this: It’s non-negotiable. No matter how busy life gets, work or errands can never creep into this sacred time.
Why This Simple Practice Works
Here’s where it gets exciting.
Most people think of growth as linear—like climbing a staircase, one step at a time. But real growth is exponential. It’s like compound interest in a bank account, except the currency is your skills, knowledge, and capabilities.
Let me break it down with some math:
If you improved by just 1% every day for 365 days, how much better would you be at the end of the year? Most people guess they’d double their abilities. But here’s the truth:
Because of the compounding effect, you’d be 37.78 times better. That’s a 3,778% improvement. Imagine walking into 2026 as a version of yourself that’s 37 times more skilled, confident, and capable.
That’s the power of non-negotiable learning time.
How to Start Non-Negotiable Learning Time
1. Block It Off
2. Take two hours a week. Put it on your calendar. Treat it like an unmissable meeting.

1. Focus on Real Learning
2. This isn’t about passive entertainment like podcasts or YouTube videos. True learning happens when you actively engage—reading a book, taking a course, or watching a Mindvalley Quest while taking notes.

1. Apply What You Learn
2. Learning is useless if you don’t act on it. Use this time to reflect on how you can apply these lessons to your life immediately.
For me, this means attending Mindvalley Mastery classes every Tuesday and Thursday. But I’ll admit, I’ve slipped up—letting work take over and skipping these sessions. That changes in 2025. My resolution is simple: Protect my learning time at all costs.

Where Should You Focus in 2025?
If you’re wondering what to focus on during your learning time, here’s where I believe the biggest opportunities lie:
1. AI Mastery
Mark my words: 2025 will be the last “normal” year in history. By 2026, AI will disrupt 50% of white-collar work. The businesses and individuals who adapt to AI will thrive. Those who don’t? They’ll struggle to keep up.
AI is already reshaping industries, from marketing to medicine. For example, I’m currently experimenting with OpenAI’s Sora to create stunning video loops for my keynote slides. The results are mind-blowing.
Start exploring tools like this now. The earlier you adopt, the bigger your advantage will be.
2. Longevity Protocols
Imagine having all the money, success, and freedom you’ve ever wanted—but no health to enjoy it. Health is wealth, and longevity is the ultimate currency.
We’re entering a new era of health science. Experts like Peter Diamandis believe we’re approaching “longevity escape velocity,” where advancements in medicine could extend human life indefinitely.
Dive into resources from Mindvalley experts like Dave Asprey, Ben Greenfield, and Ronan Diego. Learn how to slow aging, enhance vitality, and maybe even unlock decades more to live out your dreams.
3. Manifesting Mastery
Manifesting is no longer a fringe idea—it’s a proven strategy for success. In fact, Cambridge Dictionary just named “manifesting” the Word of the Year.
At its core, manifesting is about turning bold visions into reality. It’s the mindset, energy, and focus that help you move toward your dreams with resilience and purpose.
At Mindvalley, we teach practical techniques to master this skill. Whether you’re setting career goals, building a business, or creating your dream lifestyle, manifesting can accelerate your journey.
Your Role in 2025
Here’s the truth: The world is changing faster than ever. You can either be a spectator, watching it all unfold, or you can step into the driver’s seat and shape your own future.
Non-negotiable learning time is your key to staying ahead. It’s how you grow, evolve, and become 37 times better by this time next year.
So, here’s my challenge to you: Take 19 seconds right now to block out your first two hours of learning time for January. Make it sacred. Make it yours.
And if you’re ready to supercharge your growth, join me at Future Human, Mindvalley’s biggest event ever, happening in Dubai from January 9–12. We’ll dive deep into AI, longevity, and manifesting with the world’s top minds.

👉 Click here for details
Oh, and if you’re tuning into CNN International on New Year’s Eve, I’ll be sharing a special message about how to step into 2025 with purpose and clarity.
I’m live on CNN 10pm tonight (Dec 31st Dubai Time) just after midnight sharing my 2025 message for the world. 

See you then. 
Here’s to exponential growth, bold visions, and making 2025 your most transformative year yet.
Warmly,
Vishen
P.S. Don’t just read this and move on. Make your learning time sacred, and let’s grow together in 2025. A great first step, open up your Google Calendar and block off two hours every week for 2025 to focus on learning. This will take you a few minutes but this simple first step will change your life.

📧 Email:
2025: The Last Normal Year in Human History
Dear Mindvalley Family,
Here we are in 2025. I hope the year is starting off beautifully for you. But as we step into this pivotal year, there’s an idea that’s been weighing on my mind. It’s a thought so profound that it has been keeping me awake at night.
And that idea is this: 2025 will be the last “normal” year in human history.
Now, I know that sounds dramatic, even audacious. But once you see where the world is headed, you’ll understand why this year is unlike any we’ve experienced before. Let me take you on a journey through time to set the stage for what’s unfolding.
A World Frozen in Time
Let’s go back to 3 BC, to one of history’s most legendary figures—Alexander the Great. If you’re a fan of history like I am, you’ll know Alexander was a conqueror who reshaped the world as he knew it. At just 20 years old, he led an army that expanded across three continents, spreading Greek culture and uniting vast empires.
Now imagine Alexander standing in awe before the Great Pyramids of Giza. These colossal monuments, timeless and imposing, must have seemed like a glimpse of eternity to him. But here’s the astonishing part: the pyramids were already ancient when Alexander saw them—2,300 years old, to be exact.

And yet, despite the grandeur of his conquests and the cultural flourishing of his time, Alexander lived in a world that barely changed over the centuries.
Closer to the iPhone Than to the Pyramids
Now let’s add a modern twist. Alexander the Great, who stood before the pyramids, was closer in time to the invention of the iPhone than to the construction of those pyramids.
Yes, you read that right.
The same Alexander who gazed at these ancient wonders existed closer to the launch of Apple’s iPhone in 2007 than to the day those pyramids were built. Let that sink in for a moment.
And yet, for most of human history, the world barely moved forward. If Alexander had leapt 1,000 years into the future to the 12th century, he might have marveled at the majestic cathedrals of Europe or the riches of the Islamic Golden Age. But daily life? It would have been startlingly familiar. People still plowed fields by hand. They still lit their homes with oil lamps. They still relied on horses and ships to get from place to place.
Even if Alexander had jumped ahead another 500 years to the Renaissance, the printing press and gunpowder would have caught his eye. But these advancements wouldn’t have felt magical—they would have seemed like logical extensions of what he already knew.
The Century Where Magic Became Real
Now imagine Alexander fast-forwarding to the 20th century. This is where everything changes. He’d see airplanes slicing through the sky, towering skyscrapers like the Burj Khalifa (the tallest building in the world today), and those magical glass rectangles we call smartphones.
He’d watch in disbelief as humans landed on the moon. He’d witness cars driving themselves and televisions bringing moving images into every home. And then there’s the internet—a network that connects every corner of the globe, allowing instant access to the sum of human knowledge.
To Alexander, these advancements wouldn’t have seemed like progress. They’d have seemed like magic.


Peter Diamandis and the Era of Exponential Progress
What happened? How did we go from a world frozen in time to one of unimaginable transformation?
In 2016, I had the privilege of sitting down with futurist Peter Diamandis, and he explained it to me in a way I’ll never forget:
“Vishen, think of all the progress humanity made between 1900 and 2000. The airplane, the moon landing, the transistor, the internet—all of it happened in a single century. Now here’s the crazy part: the same level of technological progress we achieved in those 100 years is now being compressed into a few decades.”
Peter went on:
“Between 2000 and 2016, we saw the rise of Facebook, YouTube, Tesla, and the iPhone. But the pace of change is accelerating. From 2016 to 2022, we saw just as much innovation. And between 2022 and 2026? The same amount of progress will happen again—100 years of progress - compressed into just four years.”
I remember sitting there, stunned. Could this really be true? But now, in 2025, I see exactly what Peter meant.
The AI Explosion: Why 2025 Is Different
Over the past few years, artificial intelligence (AI) has gone from being a futuristic concept to something that’s transforming every corner of our lives. And here’s what’s truly mind-blowing: we’re just getting started.
It’s not every day that we get a glimpse into the minds of the people shaping our future. Sam Altman, CEO of OpenAI and one of the most influential figures in artificial intelligence, recently shared a revelation that stopped me in my tracks. His words confirmed what many of us have suspected but struggled to fully comprehend: we are on the brink of something truly extraordinary.
Sam revealed that his team is now confident in their ability to create Artificial General Intelligence (AGI). This is the moment we’ve all been anticipating—the point where AI isn’t just a tool but something that thinks, reasons, and adapts like a human. And that’s not all. They’re now setting their sights even higher.
Sam Altman, the founder of OpenAI (the company behind ChatGPT) just said this:

“We are now confident we know how to build AGI as we have traditionally understood it. We believe that, in 2025, we may see the first AI agents ‘join the workforce’ and materially change the output of companies. We are beginning to turn our aim beyond that, to superintelligence in the true sense of the word. Superintelligent tools could massively accelerate scientific discovery and innovation well beyond what we are capable of doing on our own, and in turn massively increase abundance and prosperity.”
Let that sink in for a moment. AGI—once a far-off dream—is now within reach. And even more astonishingly, we’re already thinking beyond AGI to superintelligence, a level of AI that could solve problems so complex they’re currently beyond human comprehension.
Imagine a world where diseases like cancer are eradicated, where scientific breakthroughs happen at a speed we can hardly fathom, and where abundance becomes the norm for humanity. This isn’t science fiction—it’s the future we’re stepping into. And 2025 is the year it begins.
What Is AGI (Artificial General Intelligence)?
AGI refers to AI that can think, reason, and learn at a human level across any task. Unlike today’s AI, which is task-specific, AGI would adapt like a human—writing novels, solving problems, or understanding emotions with the same versatility as a person.
What Is Superintelligence?
Superintelligence goes beyond AGI, surpassing human intelligence in every way. It could solve problems no human could comprehend, innovate at unimaginable speeds, and optimize systems like healthcare and energy to create abundance for all.
The Key Difference:
- AGI matches human intelligence.
- Superintelligence exceeds it, unlocking unimaginable possibilities.
Both have the potential to redefine our world.
And we are moving towards this faster than you think…
By the end of 2025, we’ll see the rise of AI agents. These aren’t just chatbots that help you answer emails. These are autonomous systems capable of solving complex problems, managing entire projects, and functioning as if they were human employees.
But the revolution doesn’t stop there. The next frontier is embodied AI—physical robots equipped with advanced AI. Imagine humanoid machines performing surgeries, constructing buildings, or even helping care for the elderly.
Your average street in 2028 will likely look like the picture below. With robots mingling with humans. 


The Opportunities—and the Risks
This is the double-edged sword of progress.
On one hand, AI has the potential to create a world we can hardly imagine:
- A world where cancer is cured, and diseases like Alzheimer’s become history.
- A planet where climate change is reversed, and clean energy powers every home.
- A future where poverty is eradicated, and abundance becomes the norm.
But with great power comes great responsibility.
What happens if AI becomes too powerful? Could it develop goals that conflict with ours? These aren’t just science fiction scenarios—they’re challenges we must address today.
How to Thrive in 2025
Let’s get real for a moment. This is not a normal year. The world is moving faster than ever, and the changes coming our way will disrupt nearly every aspect of life—from the way we work to the way we age, and even the way we think about reality itself.
If you’re wondering how to navigate these seismic shifts, you’re not alone. I’ve been asking myself the same question, and I’ve identified three key areas where I’m focusing my energy this year. These aren’t just strategies—they’re imperatives.
Here’s what I’m doing, and what I believe can help you thrive in this extraordinary time:
1. Master AI Before It Masters You
Let’s start with the obvious: AI is taking over.
I’ve already seen this happening in my own organization. Employees who embrace AI are doubling their productivity. They’re automating mundane tasks, generating creative ideas faster, and achieving results that used to take days in mere hours.
These individuals—what I call “AI-enabled super-producers”—are becoming the MVPs of the workplace. And here’s the kicker: it’s not because they’re smarter or more talented. It’s because they’ve decided to partner with AI rather than fear it.
If you’re an employee, ask yourself this:
- Are you using AI tools like ChatGPT, MidJourney, or other platforms to amplify your output? 
- Are you staying curious, experimenting with new ways to integrate AI into your work?
- Are you positioning yourself as someone who can leverage technology to solve problems faster?
If the answer is no, now is the time to start.
For CEOs and Leaders:
If you’re leading a company, you need to rethink everything you thought you knew about hiring and team management. Why? Because AI agents are coming—and they’re about to change the rules of the game.
These aren’t just digital assistants that write emails or schedule meetings. AI agents will be capable of managing entire projects, solving complex problems, and even operating with the decision-making skills of a mid-level manager.
Imagine this:
- Instead of hiring 10 new employees, you deploy 5 AI agents that can handle 70% of the workload.
- Instead of spending months training a new hire, you onboard an AI agent in hours.
- Instead of relying on outdated processes, your organization evolves in real-time, driven by AI insights.
This is the future, and it’s happening faster than you think.
How I’m Applying This:
At Mindvalley, I’ve stopped hiring in the traditional sense. Instead, we’re focusing on upskilling our existing team to become AI-enabled super-producers. My belief is that the best teams of the future won’t just be composed of humans—they’ll be humans and AI working in perfect synergy.
If you want to thrive in 2025, start thinking about how you can integrate AI into every corner of your work. Whether you’re an individual contributor, a manager, or a business owner, AI isn’t just a tool—it’s your new partner in success.
2. Invest in Longevity
Let’s talk about your health.
With the rise of AI and breakthroughs in biotech, we’re entering an era where living to 100—or even 120—will be entirely possible. But here’s the question: do you want to live those extra decades thriving or just surviving?
For me, the answer is clear. I want to thrive. I want to wake up at 100 feeling energized, flexible, and mentally sharp. And if you’re alive today, you have a chance to achieve this too—but only if you start investing in your health now.
The Future of Longevity:
AI and superintelligence are already accelerating breakthroughs in medicine. Imagine a world where diseases like cancer and Alzheimer’s are eradicated. Where stem cell treatments repair damaged organs. Where personalized medicine optimizes your body’s performance in ways we can’t yet fathom.
That future is closer than you think. And if you’re not paying attention to longevity science, you’re missing out on one of the greatest revolutions of our time.
What I’m Doing:
This year, I’m diving headfirst into advanced longevity protocols. Here are a few examples:
- Stem Cell Therapy: I’ll be working with Dr. Adil Khan in Dubai to repair a recurring back issue and enhance overall vitality.
- Muscle Optimization Protocols: I’m exploring treatments that amplify muscle growth, so every gym session delivers maximum results.
- Reversing Signs of Aging: Yes, I’m even experimenting with therapies that reduce gray hair and improve skin health. Why? Because feeling good about your appearance is part of thriving.
Now, I know some of these treatments might sound out of reach for most people. But you don’t need to start with cutting-edge science to invest in your health. The basics—regular exercise, clean eating, quality sleep—are the foundation of longevity.
Where to Start:
If you’re curious about how to begin your own longevity journey, I highly recommend Dave Asprey’s Smarter Not Harder Quest on Mindvalley. Dave, known as the father of biohacking, breaks down simple, practical strategies you can use to optimize your health today.
3. Master the Art of Manifesting
In a world of rapid change, the ability to manifest your goals and shape your reality isn’t just a nice-to-have—it’s essential.
Now, before you roll your eyes, let me explain. Manifesting isn’t about wishful thinking or repeating affirmations in the mirror. It’s about taking control of your mind and using it as a tool to create the life you want.
What Manifesting Really Means:
- Clarity: Get crystal-clear on what you want to achieve in 2025. What’s your vision for your career, your health, your relationships? Write it down. Make it vivid.
- Resilience: The world is unpredictable. Manifesting requires building mental toughness, so you can stay focused even when life throws curveballs.
- Actionable Steps: Manifesting isn’t magic—it’s a system. Break your goals into tangible, actionable steps, and commit to them daily.
How It Works:
At Mindvalley, we’ve been teaching manifestation techniques for years, and I can tell you this: the results are real. From creating abundance to transforming relationships, the power of your mind is limitless—if you know how to harness it.
To dive deeper, join us at our Manifesting Mastery Event this month. Alongside incredible teachers like Reagan Hillier and Jeffrey Allen, I’ll be sharing tools to help you navigate this era of disruption with clarity and purpose.
Why These 3 Areas Matter
Here’s the bottom line: 2025 is a year of transformation. The rules are changing, and the opportunities are endless. But if you’re not prepared—if you don’t adapt—you risk being left behind.
By mastering AI, investing in your health, and sharpening your ability to manifest, you’re not just surviving this era of change—you’re thriving in it.
Join Us at the Future Human Event Live this Weekend (on Zoom or in person in Dubai)
This weekend, we’re hosting the Future of Humans Festival in Dubai—a gathering of some of the brightest minds and most inspiring thought leaders on the planet. If you’ve been following the conversation around AI, longevity, and human potential, this event is where it all comes together.
Here’s what makes this festival extraordinary:
- Game-Changing Ideas: We’ll explore the themes shaping the future—AI, longevity science, human consciousness, and more. These are ideas that will help you stay ahead of the curve in 2025 and beyond.
- World-Class Speakers: The lineup includes icons like Steven Bartlett (Diary of a CEO), Jay Shetty, Grammy-winning artist Eve, and Mindvalley legends like Reagan Hillier, Lisa Nichols, Marisa Peer and Dave Asprey.
- Incredible Community: Whether in person or online, you’ll connect with a global tribe of visionaries, thinkers, and doers who are as committed to growth as you are.
Can’t Make It to Dubai?
No problem. You can join us virtually for just $29. This isn’t just a live stream—it’s a fully immersive experience. With Mindvalley’s new Zoom feature, you can watch the event in simulated real-time, tailored to your time zone. So even if you’re on the other side of the world, you won’t miss a thing.
Why just $29? Because we believe the knowledge being shared at this festival is too important to keep exclusive. We want to make it accessible to as many people as possible.

Join Online from Your Home on Zoom for just $29 


Reserve Your Virtual Ticket Here
Let’s make 2025 the year you step into your full potential. I can’t wait to see you at the festival—either live in Dubai or virtually from wherever you are.
Let’s make this the year we rise to the challenge and step into our highest potential.
To your limitless future,
Vishen Lakhiani
Founder, Mindvalley

Name: Vishen's Newsletter: The Future Is Human: 6 Transformative Insights from Dubai ["1,2: Daily", "1,2: Highlights ", "1,2: Weekly", 3: Members, 5: Coach, "1,2,3: Vishen's List", 5: Events, 6: Mastery]
Title: Vishen's Newsletter: The Future Is Human: 6 Transformative Insights from Dubai
📧 Audience: "1,2: Daily","1,2: Highlights ","1,2: Weekly",3: Members,5: Coach,"1,2,3: Vishen's List",5: Events,6: Mastery
📧 Email:
Subject Lines:
Primary Options:
1. "The Future Is Human: 6 Transformative Insights from Dubai"
2. Preheader: AI, longevity, manifestation, and more—wisdom to elevate your life.
3. "6 Profound Lessons to Create Your Future"
4. Preheader: A personal message from Vishen on unlocking your potential.
5. "The Keys to Your Next Breakthrough"
6. Preheader: Insights from Future Human to reshape your reality.
Opening: A Personal Note from Vishen 
Dear (name),
This year, something extraordinary happened. 
Over 8,000 people gathered—3,000 of us live in Dubai, and 5,000 more joining virtually—for Future Human. It was the largest event in Mindvalley’s history, and for three unforgettable days, we explored the intersection of technology, consciousness, and human potential.
We weren’t just imagining the future; we were building it.
But here’s the thing: the insights we uncovered weren’t meant to stay confined to the walls of that event. They’re meant for you, wherever you are in the world.
Today, I want to share 6 of the most powerful lessons from Future Human—lessons that have the potential to unlock something extraordinary in your life. These aren’t just ideas; they’re action steps, infused with wisdom and designed to elevate your journey.
So grab a cup of tea, sit back, and let’s dive into the future—together.
6 Transformative Insights from Future Human
1. Will AI Develop a Soul? – Jay Shetty

Jay Shetty posed a question that left everyone in the room in deep thought: Can AI ever have a soul?
We’re living in a time when AI is creating art, composing music, and even holding conversations. But Jay reminded us that AI, no matter how advanced, will never replicate what makes us human: our ability to love, empathize, and connect.
This isn’t just about AI—it’s about us. The future demands that we nurture our humanity. It’s not about fearing machines; it’s about amplifying our unique gifts. How will you bring more soul into the world?
2. The Power of Intuition – Vishen Lakhiani

Let me tell you something deeply personal: every pivotal moment in my life was guided by intuition.
At Future Human, I shared how intuition isn’t just a mysterious force—it’s a skill we can cultivate. In a world overwhelmed with information, intuition becomes your inner compass, guiding you toward clarity and alignment.
Imagine navigating life not with doubt but with certainty, knowing your next step is exactly where you’re meant to be. That’s what intuition offers. Are you ready to trust yours?
3. Evicting Your Limiting Beliefs – Lisa Nichols

Lisa Nichols didn’t just speak—she transformed the room.
She asked us a powerful question: What story are you living by, and is it even yours?
So many of us live by narratives we didn’t write—beliefs handed down from family, culture, or society. Lisa shared how she rewrote her own story, showing us that we can all release what no longer serves us and step into our power.
What’s one belief you’re ready to evict? And what’s the new story you’ll write in its place?
5. How to Become the Best in the World – Steven Bartlett

Steven Bartlett revealed the science behind peak performance. His message? Excellence isn’t talent—it’s training.
Through flow states and deliberate practice, Steven showed how anyone can achieve mastery in any field. But the key isn’t a one-time effort—it’s daily consistency.
What’s one small habit you can start today to take a step closer to greatness?
4. Manifest Infinite Potential – Regan Hillyer

Regan Hillyer guided us into the art and science of manifestation with one profound insight: Your reality mirrors the energy you hold.
Manifestation isn’t just about thinking positive—it’s about alignment. Regan showed us how to raise our frequency, align with our desires, and bring them into reality.
For those ready to go deeper, don’t miss our upcoming event, Masters of Manifesting, where we’ll explore the principles and practices of infinite potential.
6. Filling the Void Within – Marisa Peer

Marisa Peer addressed something deeply universal: the emptiness we often feel, even when life seems “fine.”
Her solution? Stop waiting for others to fill that void. Instead, meet your own emotional needs. Marisa shared a simple but transformative practice: every day, look in the mirror and say, “I am enough.”
It’s a small act that can create profound change. Are you ready to fill your cup?
Your Next Steps: Mindvalley Events and More
Transformation isn’t a one-time experience—it’s a journey. That’s why we’re creating opportunities for you to continue exploring, connecting, and growing.
Here’s how you can take your next step:
1. Follow Mindvalley on Instagram: @Mindvalley. This is where we share bite-sized wisdom, behind-the-scenes moments, and updates on upcoming events.
2. Explore Future Events: Check out mindvalleyevents.com to discover life-changing experiences designed to elevate you.
3. Dive Deeper into Manifestation: Join us for Masters of Manifesting to unlock the principles of creating your dream life.
Closing: From My Heart to Yours
Here’s the thing: the future isn’t something we wait for. It’s something we create—through our actions, our thoughts, and the energy we bring to the world.
The six insights I’ve shared today are more than just lessons—they’re invitations. Invitations to listen to your intuition, rewrite your story, and align with your infinite potential.
But remember, transformation doesn’t happen in isolation. It happens in community. So follow us on Instagram, join an upcoming event, and connect with a tribe that’s on the same journey.
Your best future is waiting. Let’s create it together.
To your extraordinary potential,
Vishen

Newsletter: The 30-Minute Longevity Hack That Transformed My Dad’s Life

Hey there,
Let me ask you something: When you imagine yourself at 70 or 80, what do you see? Are you climbing stairs with ease? Dancing at your grandkids’ wedding? Or are you struggling to even get up from the couch?
Here’s the thing about longevity: It’s not just about living longer—it’s about living better. That means adding more years to your life and more life to your years. And that’s what Day 2 of Future Human was all about: cracking the code on longevity, vitality, and thriving well into your 80s, 90s, and beyond.
(By the way, if you missed it, I just posted some of my favorite photos from Day 2 on Instagram. Go check them out! See if you can guess which of the three elderly ladies in the first photo is my mom. Hint: She’s rocking the kind of energy that’ll make you wonder if she found the fountain of youth.)


Now, back to longevity. On Day 2, we heard from some of the world’s top minds, including Dave Asprey, Ronan Diego, Lisa Nichols, and others. They talked about everything from biohacking and breathwork to the power of community. But one thing stood out to me—something so simple yet profound—it might just be the ultimate hack for staying young.
]

It’s your muscles.
Muscles: Your Secret Weapon for Longevity
Let me explain. There’s this fascinating concept I learned at Future Human. One of the strongest predictors of longevity is muscle strength. Why? Because your muscles are directly tied to so many vital functions: mobility, energy levels, and even your ability to maintain a sense of independence and connection as you age.
But here’s the kicker. You don’t need to spend hours in the gym. You don’t need to aim for the “gym bro” look or worry about getting a six-pack. This isn’t about vanity—it’s about functional strength.
In fact, you can dramatically improve your muscle health—and your lifespan—with just 30 minutes a week.
My Dad’s Journey: From Struggling to Thriving

Let me share a story to show you how powerful this is.
When my dad turned 70, he got some devastating news from his doctor. He was in such poor shape that the doctor estimated he might only have five years left to live.
Hearing this broke my heart. So, I decided to do something about it. I introduced my dad to Lorenzo Delano, one of the brilliant minds behind Mindvalley’s 10X Fitness program.
Now, Lorenzo didn’t throw my dad into some crazy boot camp. Instead, he guided him through a simple, science-backed protocol: 30 minutes in the gym, once a week. That’s it.
When my dad started, he could leg press 80 kilograms (~176 lbs). After just four weeks, his strength increased to 150 kilograms (~330 lbs). That’s an 80% increase in strength—with less than 2 hours of total gym time.
The transformation was incredible. Suddenly, my dad could hike, climb stairs, and do things he hadn’t been able to do in years. A few years later, he and I even went hiking in the desert of Jordan at Petra—a feat that would’ve been impossible before.
What’s happening here? It’s all about reversing sarcopenia—the natural muscle loss that starts in your 30s and accelerates as you age. The best part? According to Lorenzo, reversing this muscle loss takes just 2 hours of exercise per year.
Yes, you read that right. Two hours a year can keep your muscles from wasting away and help you maintain the strength you had at 30 well into your 70s.

The Science Behind 10X: Minimum Effective Dose
So how does this work? The magic of 10X lies in something called the minimum effective dose. It’s a concept inspired by Doug McGuff, MD, author of the groundbreaking book Body by Science.
Here’s the gist: Instead of spending hours at the gym, you focus on five key exercises that give you the biggest bang for your buck.
Here are the exercises we recommend:
1. Leg Press
2. Lat Pulldown
3. Chest Press
4. Cable Row
5. Shoulder Press
And here’s how you do them:
- Use 65–70% of your one-rep max (the heaviest weight you can lift once).
- Do 1 set of 10–14 reps per exercise.
- Each rep takes 5 seconds: 2 seconds pushing or pulling, and 3 seconds on the return.
- Move from one machine to the next without resting.
This protocol puts your muscles under just enough strain to stimulate growth, without overworking them. And because it’s so efficient, the whole session takes only 30 minutes, including time to check into the gym and grab your stuff from your locker.
Do this once or twice a week, and you’ll not only reverse muscle loss—you’ll feel stronger, more energized, and more capable than ever.
Take this case study of a 10X user from the US Military. Mary (name changed) was already fit as she was in the army. But check out her before and after results when she started with 10X. The most impressive is that her body fat fell from 43% to 23% in 6 months and her total workout time in the gym was 40 mins PER WEEK.

Your Longevity Starts Now
If you’re intrigued by this, I highly recommend trying it out for yourself. You don’t need fancy equipment or hours of free time. All you need is a gym, 30 minutes, and a commitment to your health.
Here’s the one-page guide we provided at Future Human.

And if you’re a Mindvalley Member, you can dive deeper into the 10X Fitness Quest, where Lorenzo and his team walk you through every step of the process.
To hear more about people who’ve transformed their lives with 10X Fitness, check out stories.mindvalley.com. You’ll find incredible stories of people in their 40s, 50s, 60s, and beyond who’ve used this method to reclaim their strength and vitality.
Here’s the link to read over 100 case studies from our users
https://stories.mindvalley.com/product/10x-fitness
This isn’t just about adding years to your life. It’s about making those years count. Because the goal isn’t just to live longer—it’s to live better.
Here’s to your health and longevity,
Vishen

Subject Lines (Primary)
The C.R.Y.S.T.A.L Formula: Manifest Your Best Life in 7 Steps


Optional Preheaders
“7 steps to clarity, alignment, and bringing your dreams to life.”


	The C.R.Y.S.T.A.L Formula: 7 Keys to Manifesting Your Best Life

I just got back from an incredible experience in Dubai: Masters of Manifesting. This event wasn’t just about the power of manifesting—it was about taking what feels intangible and giving it form, structure, and flow.
Manifesting is one of the most sought-after topics at Mindvalley, and it’s something I’ve personally explored for decades. To me, manifesting is the art of turning the dreams in your mind into reality—faster, more effectively, and with greater joy and ease.
At this event, we brought together amazing speakers like Reagan Hillyer (The Art of Manifesting), Jeffrey Allen (Duality and Unlocking Transcendence), John Lee (Seven Figure Creator), and yes, me.

As I sat there taking notes from these incredible minds, a powerful realization struck me: manifesting doesn’t have to feel mysterious or complex. There’s a simple, actionable framework anyone can follow.
I call it the CRYSTAL formula—seven key steps that make your manifesting journey crystal clear. Whether you’re manifesting a dream job, a soulmate, financial freedom, or just a better version of yourself, this formula can help you bring it to life.
Let’s dive in.
C: Clarity
“Vague desires produce vague results.”
Let’s start with the foundation. Clarity is the most important step in manifesting—and also the most overlooked.
If your vision is fuzzy, your results will be, too. You can’t just say, “I want more money” or “I want a better job.” You need to get specific. What’s the exact salary you want? What kind of company do you want to work for? What’s the daily experience you want to create for yourself?
Here’s how to get crystal clear:
1. Write it down. Goals written down are 42% more likely to be achieved.
2. Visualize it. Close your eyes and create a vivid mental picture. What does your ideal life look like?
3. Use tools. Programs like Mindvalley’s Lifebook guide you to map out your entire life vision in extraordinary detail, creating a personal blueprint for your future.
The clearer your vision, the easier it is to focus your energy. Clarity creates alignment, and alignment creates momentum.

R: Resilience
“The road to success isn’t linear—it’s a rollercoaster.”
Let’s be honest: manifesting your dreams isn’t always smooth sailing. You will face setbacks, challenges, and moments of doubt. The key is how you respond when things don’t go as planned.
Michael Beckwith, one of my mentors, talks about “Kensho moments”—growth that comes through challenges. These are the times when life throws you into the fire, testing your strength and commitment.
Resilience is about developing the grit to move forward, no matter what. But it’s also about self-compassion. Treat yourself with kindness. Love yourself through the tough moments.
Here’s how to cultivate resilience:
1. Reframe setbacks. Ask yourself, “What lesson is this trying to teach me?”
2. Anchor yourself in your vision. Remind yourself of your “why.”
3. Celebrate progress. Every small step forward is a victory worth celebrating.
Manifesting is a journey, not a straight line. Stay resilient, and you’ll turn obstacles into stepping stones.

Y: Your Inner Voice
“Listen to your heart and intuition. Somehow, they already know who you are meant to become.” – Steve Jobs
Too often, we set goals based on what others expect of us—parents, society, culture. But true manifesting starts when you connect with your inner voice.
Intuition is like a compass, pointing you toward what’s aligned with your soul. But to hear it, you need to quiet the external noise: the societal expectations, the cultural pressures, and the opinions of others.
Here’s how to strengthen your intuition:
- Meditate. Silence the chatter in your mind.
- Journal. Writing helps you uncover your inner truth.
- Ask yourself. When faced with a decision, pause and ask, “Does this feel expansive or restrictive?”
When you trust your inner voice, you align with your deepest truths—and that’s where the real magic happens.

S: Speed of Action
“Don’t wait for the perfect moment. Start now.”
Manifesting isn’t just about thinking—it’s about doing. The moment you take action, you tell the universe: “I’m serious about this.”
Napoleon Hill, in Think and Grow Rich, emphasizes the power of small, consistent steps. Every action, no matter how small, builds momentum.
Let’s say you’re starting a business. Here’s how to break it down:
1. Research domain names.
2. Register your business.
3. Sketch out your first product idea.
4. Each step creates clarity for the next. Action isn’t just about progress—it’s about signaling your intention to the universe.

T: Trust
“What you believe about the world tends to become true.” 
Trust is the cornerstone of manifesting. It’s about belief and expectancy. José Silva, the legendary founder of the Silva Method, taught that manifesting isn’t just about desire. It’s about three things:
1. Desire. Get clear on what you want.
2. Belief. Cultivate unshakable faith that it’s possible.
3. Expectancy. Act as if it’s already happening.
The law of resonance says that the universe reflects who you are, not what you want. When you believe and expect your vision to come true, you align yourself with the frequency of your desires.
Visualization is one of the most powerful tools here. José Silva emphasized the importance of imagining your goals so vividly that your brain starts treating them as real. We call this approach Creative Visualization. Programs like Be Extraordinary and Creative Visualization teach this in depth, helping you turn belief into reality.

A: Alignment
“When your energy, mind, and body align, magic happens.”
Manifesting isn’t just about action—it’s about energy. Alignment means syncing your physical, emotional, and spiritual states with your desires.
Practices like gratitude, forgiveness, and compassion aren’t just feel-good exercises—they’re scientifically proven to elevate your vibration. For example, studies show that forgiveness can improve physical performance and even increase endurance.
Here’s how to get aligned:
- Practice forgiveness to release emotional blocks.
- Use gratitude to elevate your energy.
- Meditate to center your mind and body.
Jeffrey Allen’s program Duality is perfect for this, teaching you how to align your energy with your goals. And the 6 Phase Meditation is a daily practice that shifts you into a state of flow, amplifying your ability to manifest.

L: Love Your Journey
“Gratitude turns your journey into a masterpiece.”
This step is about embracing the process. Manifesting isn’t just about achieving—it’s about experiencing joy along the way.
Tim Storey calls this “magical living.” and goes deep into it in his Quest on Mindvalley. It’s about appreciating the small, beautiful moments in life. 
Recently, I spoke with Grammy-winning artist Eve, who shared her personal gratitude practice: “I simply express gratitude for everything—the sun, the trees, the flowers. It keeps me grounded and joyful.”
When you focus on gratitude, you amplify the joy and abundance in your life, which, in turn, attracts more of it.
		
Final Thoughts
The CRYSTAL formula is more than just a checklist—it’s a lifestyle. Each step builds on the others, creating a powerful framework to manifest your dreams.
Now, let me share something truly exciting.
If you’ve been scrolling through social media recently, you’ve probably seen the jaw-dropping photos from our Mindvalley Gala at the iconic Dubai Expo. It was a night where transformation met luxury—a celebration of the world’s greatest teachers, innovators, and thought leaders.
The energy in that room was unlike anything I’ve ever experienced. Imagine standing under the stunning Dubai skyline, surrounded by people like Steven Kotler, Jay Shetty, Regan Hillyer, and Paul McKenna. Each story, each standing ovation, each moment of connection—it was a collective manifestation of what’s possible when we dream big and act boldly.
And we thought, why should this energy be limited to one night?

Introducing the Best of Membership Summit
So, here’s what we’ve done: we’re recreating the magic of the gala and packing it into a free, two-day online event. It’s called the Best of Membership Summit, and it’s happening on February 8 and 9.
This isn’t just another online summit. This is your chance to experience the brilliance of Mindvalley’s top teachers—the ones who’ve transformed lives around the world—right from the comfort of your home.
Expect to be inspired, challenged, and equipped with tools that will elevate every area of your life. Whether you’re new to Mindvalley or have been part of our family for years, this is the perfect opportunity to deepen your journey and connect with the energy of transformation.
What Makes This Summit So Special?
We’re bringing the same world-class thought leaders you’ve seen on the gala stage—like Regan Hillyer, Paul McKenna, and Marie Diamond—and many more surprise guests. You’ll get access to their best teachings, tools, and practices designed to help you level up every aspect of your life.
This is your moment to immerse yourself in the wisdom of the best, tap into the energy of a global community, and supercharge your journey to growth—all in just two days.
And the best part? It’s completely free.
Yes, you heard that right. We’re giving you the same level of inspiration, education, and transformation that makes Mindvalley legendary—and all you need to do is show up.
Join Us for This Extraordinary Event
Here’s your next step:
Go here to register: [Insert link]
Trust me, you don’t want to miss this. Mark your calendar, clear your schedule, and get ready for two days that could change the trajectory of your life.
This isn’t just an event—it’s a movement. And you’re invited.
With love, clarity, and excitement,
Vishen
